text: New paper on Spatial Data Analysis.
Best Paper Award at SIBGRAPI 2020 on analisys of urban crimes.
New paper Visual CrimAnalyzer: Understanding Crime Patterns in São Paulo.
Congrats Prof. Jorge Poco for received the Most Influential Scholar Award Honorable Mention in Visualization at AMiner.org.
Prof. Jorge Poco was recognized as Distinguished Young Researcher by FAPERJ.
New paper accepted CriPAV: Street-Level Crime Patterns Analysis and Visualization (in-press).
New paper on Online Timeslicing.
New accepted papers DRIFT: A Visual Analytic Tool and Urban Perception.
Paper DRIFT has received an Honorable Mention in Visualization.
Paper Mirante has received the Best Paper Award in Visualization.
New paper accepted 17K-Graffiti: Spatial and Crime Data Assessments in São Paulo City.
New paper published JamVis: Exploration and Visualization of Traffic Jams.
New paper accepted Exploring Scientific Literature by Textual and Image Content using DRIFT.
New paper accepted LegalVis: Exploring and Inferring Precedent Citations in Legal Documents.
New paper published How Do Curricular Design Changes Impact Computer Science Programs?.
New paper published Combining Clutter Reduction Methods for Temporal Network Visualization.
New paper published ClinicalPath: A Visualization Tool to Improve the Evaluation of Electronic Health Records in Clinical Decision-Making.
New paper published SDAVis: A Visualization System for Student Dropout Analysis Based on Counterfactual Exploration.
New poster published Analyzing the Equity of the Brazilian National High School Exam by Validating the Item Response Theory's Invariance
New paper accepted LargeNetVis: Visual Exploration of Large Temporal Networks Based on Community Taxonomies.
New paper published Mining Pareto-Optimal Counterfactual Antecedents with a Branch-And-Bound Model-Agnostic Algorithm.
New paper accepted WSAM: Visual Explanations from Style Augmentation as Adversarial Attacker and their Influence in Image Classification.
New paper published Enforcing Fairness using Ensemble of Diverse Pareto-Optimal Models.
New paper published MoReVis: A Visual Summary for Spatiotemporal Moving Regions.
New paper published Distill n’ Explain: Explaining Graph Neural Networks Using Simple Surrogates.
⭐ The paper Visual Exploration of Big Spatio-Temporal Urban Data: A Study of New York City Cab Trips has received the IEEE VIS Test of Time Award and will be awarded in Melbourne.
Congrats Lucas Resck for the poster presented at the Tropical Probabilistic AI School 2024.
New paper published Granularity at Scale: Estimating Neighborhood Socioeconomic Indicators from High-Resolution Orthographic Imagery and Hybrid Learning.
New paper accepted Exploring the Trade-off Between Model Performance and Explanation Plausibility of Text Classifiers Using Human Rationales.
Congrats Lucas Resck for the poster presented at the latinX in NLP at NAACL 2024 workshop.
Professor Jorge discusses AI in the magazine Cojuntura Economica: blog and full article.
New paper accepted Empirical analysis of Binding Precedent efficiency in the Brazilian Supreme Court via Similar Case Retrieval.
New paper presented What Makes a Place Feel Safe? Analyzing Street View Images to Identify Relevant Visual Elements.
New paper published Assessing Timber Trade Networks and Supply Chains in Brazil.
New paper published ZigzagNetVis: Suggesting Temporal Resolutions for Graph Visualization using Zigzag Persistence.
